This changes introduces an object cache that stores already known gone
client to not wait 60 seconds and hold a connection of the pool
Keeping 200 last gone rpc client for 1 minute is enough
and doesn't hold to much memory.

This also don't raise anymore a frightening exception when we can't send reply
to the rpc client. But just logging a info about missing exchange and
a warning about unsend reply.

Closes-bug: #1460652
(cherry picked from commit 1ac7f03e053abf513a6b65b7c29ae4d0d04cbee3)

Conflicts:
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp.py
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

Change-Id: I9afda097e3353c243f99de33f15e15d7ccad7c77

commit_message:
Don't reply when we known that client is gone

In case of a broker restart/failover a reply queue can be
unreachable for short period the IncomingMessage.send_reply
will block for 60 seconds in this case or until rabbit recovers.

But in case of the reply queue is unreachable because the
rpc client is really gone, we can have a ton of reply to send
waiting 60 seconds.
This leads to a starvation of connection of the pool
The rpc server take to much time to send reply, other rpc client will
raise TimeoutError because their don't receive their replies in time.

This changes introduces an object cache that stores already known gone
client to not wait 60 seconds and hold a connection of the pool
Keeping 200 last gone rpc client for 1 minute is enough
and doesn't hold to much memory.

This also don't raise anymore a frightening exception when we can't send reply
to the rpc client. But just logging a info about missing exchange and
a warning about unsend reply.

Closes-bug: #1460652
(cherry picked from commit 1ac7f03e053abf513a6b65b7c29ae4d0d04cbee3)

Conflicts:
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp.py
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

Change-Id: I9afda097e3353c243f99de33f15e15d7ccad7c77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/03/256203/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Add spec for CMC + related rfcs

rfc5272 needs to be redone

Change-Id: I07a570fd3138564d09ceed0f6f02f79cc3f60076

subject: Add Wrapper classes for list, dict, tuple, str, bool
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 06:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/8a647c860b05b6958044081ec99b32212ecef65c', 'message': "Add Wrapper classes for list, dict, tuple, str, bool

Added wrapper classes which are inherited from base
data types list, tuple, dict and str. This wrapper class
contains 'request_ids' as attribute.

Added 'request_ids' attribute to resource object.

This change is required to return 'request_id' from

Change-Id: Iaa413a4219ad0aa9d0fb636ab830ccb2b16c6ec3

commit_message:
Add Wrapper classes for list, dict, tuple, str, bool

Added wrapper classes which are inherited from base
data types list, tuple, dict and str. This wrapper class
contains 'request_ids' as attribute.

Added 'request_ids' attribute to resource object.

This change is required to return 'request_id' from
client to log request_id mappings of cross projects.

Change-Id: Iaa413a4219ad0aa9d0fb636ab830ccb2b16c6ec3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/33/225033/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, manager, info, loaded=False, request_ids=None): :param request_ids: request-id or list of request-ids if isinstance(request_ids, list): self.request_ids = request_ids else: self.request_ids = [request_ids] if k[0] != '_' and k not in ['manager', 'request_ids']) class ListWithMeta(list): """Wrapper class for 'list' data type. Wrapper class for list data type with 'request_ids' attribute. """ def __init__(self, values, request_ids): super(ListWithMeta, self).__init__(values) if isinstance(request_ids, list): self.request_ids = request_ids else: self.request_ids = [request_ids] class DictWithMeta(dict): """Wrapper class for 'dict' data type. Wrapper class for dict data type with 'request_ids' attribute. """ def __init__(self, values, request_ids): super(DictWithMeta, self).__init__(values) if isinstance(request_ids, list): self.request_ids = request_ids else: self.request_ids = [request_ids] class TupleWithMeta(tuple): """Wrapper class for 'tuple' data type. Wrapper class for tuple data type with 'request_ids' attribute. """ def __new__(cls, values, request_ids): obj = super(TupleWithMeta, cls).__new__(cls, values) if isinstance(request_ids, list): obj.request_ids = request_ids else: obj.request_ids = [request_ids] return obj class BoolWithMeta(int): """Wrapper class for 'bool' data type. Wrapper class for bool data type with 'request_ids' attribute. This returns bool like object but 'isinstance' check will fail in this case. """ def __new__(cls, value, request_ids): obj = super(BoolWithMeta, cls).__new__(cls, bool(value)) if isinstance(request_ids, list): obj.request_ids = request_ids else: obj.request_ids = [request_ids] return obj def __repr__(self): return ['False', 'True'][self] class StrWithMeta(str): """Wrapper class for 'str' data type. Wrapper class for str data type with 'request_ids' attribute. """ def __new__(cls, value, request_ids): obj = super(StrWithMeta, cls).__new__(cls, value) if isinstance(request_ids, list): obj.request_ids = request_ids else: obj.request_ids = [request_ids] return obj
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, manager, info, loaded=False): if k[0] != '_' and k != 'manager')

revisions:

In HTTPClient,we need to get_token with auth_url

Change-Id: I0c8a69d4a6e82aaad845ae99200b2779a622dcaf

commit_message:
Authenticate with HTTPClient

In HTTPClient,we need to get_token with auth_url
when token not exsit and do retry in case of token expiration.

Change-Id: I0c8a69d4a6e82aaad845ae99200b2779a622dcaf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/16/269416/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import netutils self.userid = kwargs.get('user_id') self.tenantid = kwargs.get('tenant_id') self.tenantname = kwargs.get('tenant_name') self.auth_system = kwargs.get('auth_system', 'keystone') self.ks_version = "v2.0" if (resp.status_code == 401 or (resp.status_code == 500 and "(HTTP 401)" in resp.content)): raise exc.HTTPUnauthorized("Authentication failed. Please try " "again.\n%s" if not self.auth_token: self.authenticate() resp = None try: kwargs['headers']['X-Auth-Token'] = self.auth_token resp = self._http_request(url, method, **kwargs) except exc.HTTPUnauthorized as e: try: self.authenticate() kwargs['headers']['X-Auth-Token'] = self.auth_token resp = self._http_request(url, method, **kwargs) except exc.HTTPUnauthorized: raise e if resp: body = resp.content if body and 'application/json' in resp.headers['content-type']: try: body = resp.json() except ValueError: LOG.error('Could not decode response body as JSON') else: body = None def authenticate(self): if self.auth_token: return if not self.auth_url: msg = ("Authentication requires 'auth_url', which should be " "specified in '%s'") % self.__class__.__name__ raise exc.HTTPUnauthorized(msg) path = netutils.urlsplit(self.auth_url).path path_parts = path.split('/') for part in path_parts: if len(part) > 0 and part[0] == 'v': self.ks_version = part break auth_url = self.auth_url # FIXME(aaron.d): This should be optimize if self.ks_version == "v2.0": if not self.auth_system or self.auth_system == 'keystone': auth_url = self._v2_auth(auth_url) else: # TODO(aaron.d): Auth from other msg = ("Authentication failed, invalid auth_url: %s") % auth_url raise exc.HTTPUnauthorized(msg) def _v2_auth(self, url): """Authenticate against a v2.0 auth service.""" if self.auth_token: body = {"auth": { "token": {"id": self.auth_token}}} elif self.userid: body = {"auth": { "passwordCredentials": {"userId": self.userid, "password": self.password}}} else: body = {"auth": { "passwordCredentials": {"username": self.username, "password": self.password}}} if self.tenantid: body['auth']['tenantId'] = self.tenantid elif self.tenantname: body['auth']['tenantName'] = self.tenantname return self._authenticate(url, body) def _authenticate(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Authenticate and extract the service catalog.""" method = "POST" token_url = url + "/tokens" kwargs['headers'] = copy.deepcopy(kwargs.get('headers', {})) kwargs['headers'].setdefault('User-Agent', USER_AGENT) kwargs['headers']['Content-Type'] = 'application/json' kwargs['data'] = jsonutils.dumps(body) resp = requests.request( method, token_url, **kwargs) if resp.status_code == 200 or resp.status_code == 201: content = jsonutils.loads(resp.content) self.auth_token = content['access']['token']['id']

commit_message:
Run package-intalls with py3k if we must

Use dib-python to run package-installs using the provided python
version. Automatically detect the python version for our
package-installs-squash since that runs outside the chroot.

Change-Id: I926022bcf8cbcd81b051026ffd5d6477650045ad

commit_message:
dashboard create flat network error

Create a failed float type using dashboard create a network,
Because /etc/neutron/plugin.ini
[ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = public

If you want to create a flat type of network time necessary to
specify the name public, but I failed to create,in case

/etc/neutron/plugin.ini [ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = *

Then I create a flat type of network when it arbitrarily designated name.
After the configuration I created on the dashboard of success

Change-Id: Ia15e29f79a0edb58dd053c35892685bb9eadb032
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/13/268913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 16:20:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3f7c7efb2f8c08551cb585b078ba4c739d39698a', 'message': 'Improved the error message when flavor creation fails

commit_message:
Improve field validation/error handling for flavor creation

Currently, if a user tries to create a new flavor or rename a flavor
to a name that already exists, a field validation error will be shown
that tells the user that the name is already being used by another
flavor.

It seems, however, that the validation does not catch the case where the
user enters a flavor name that is the same string but just with
uppercase/lowercase differences.  Since this is not caught during the
form validation, nova runs into an error later and thus throws an
exception that leaves the user with a generic error message like
"Unable to create flavor".

To improve the form field validation and prevent the error from ever
occurring in Nova, I switched the name comparisons to use the .lower()
method.  This was done for both Creating and Editing Flavor names.

Change-Id: I44dcd98978e57282b44fdab8f134500eb9b03881
Closes-Bug: #1179607
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/60/266460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Python3: Use urllib from six.moves

Made necessary changes to use urllib package from six.moves.

Remove unused class method

get_instance_info() is defined and used in Nova client, the one
in Instance provider is unused and makes no sence, remove it.

refactor: Drop meaningless 'api' attribute from NeutronCommand class

'api' attribute in NeutronCommand class was required by
OpenStackCommand class. It is now meaningless.

commit_message:
refactor: Remove usage of useless command.command.OpenStackCommand

It seems OpenStackCommand was introduced to make neutronclient
comamnds usable in OpenStack client, but at now OpenStack client
directly implements cliff Command and does not require this kind
of wrapper. To simplify the code, this commit drops the useless class.

Partial-Bug: #1532258
Change-Id: Iaa5ce9f4b98d5c85ee6ba0303067e65a829fc78e

commit_message:
Replace InstanceNotFound exception to internal exception

libvirt is incorrectly using InstanceNotFound as an internal
exception. This is an information leak and difficult to understand
what's going on. libvirt should use an internal exception instead.

Change-Id: I88d2dc1b6cdeef3ed7f288dcb70c13b5bbe9d315
Closes-Bug: #1522454

commit_message:
notification: Use oslo.messaging batch listener

This change uses the batch oslo.messaging listener
for the notification-agent but configures it have the same
behavior as the legacy one.

Change-Id: I460ab9dc387eb56108b5bceb7415c3ee6538bc54
Depends-On: I16184da24b8661aff7f4fba6196ecf33165f1a77

commit_message:
Add the swap and ephemeral BDMs if needed

After preparing the block device mapping for creating new instance(s),
check if any ephemeral and/or a swap disks have been already defined. If
that is not the case and the instance type requires them, create the
needed ephemeral and/or swap BDMs.

Closes-Bug: #1297325
Related-Bug: #1457527
Change-Id: I44b30625cf1023d20ebec5e38f46b7b8dab325f6

commit_message:
py26/py33 are no longer supported by Infra's CI

Python 3.3/2.6 support would be dropped by
Infra team from mitaka,CI would no longer be testing it,
so projects should drop it also.

Change-Id: Iab6bae525ca5a7da21ef23fe60e73b6587706d85

subject: Fix ChunkedBackupDriver _create_container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 14:44:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_backup_swift.py', 'cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/788ac9d982e69df3c2d23f1202686eefeaa407ff', 'message': 'Fix ChunkedBackupDriver _create_container

Current _create_container method in ChunkedBackupDriver is not behaving
as expected.

According to update_container_name docstring the method should return
None if the container name that comes in to the driver is to be used,
but code was using backup_default_container instead.

Also, if None is returned by update_container_name the logging will
report that it will be using None instead of the name that it will be
really using.

If update_container_name returns the same value we already have in the
DB, driver will unnecessarily update the DB.

This patch fixes all this.

Change-Id: I2aeac37f5533b6bf0c10dd6bfe45224a25f39ea6
Closes-Bug: #1534182
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ChunkedBackupDriver _create_container

Current _create_container method in ChunkedBackupDriver is not behaving
as expected.

According to update_container_name docstring the method should return
None if the container name that comes in to the driver is to be used,
but code was using backup_default_container instead.

Also, if None is returned by update_container_name the logging will
report that it will be using None instead of the name that it will be
really using.

If update_container_name returns the same value we already have in the
DB, driver will unnecessarily update the DB.

This patch fixes all this.

Change-Id: I2aeac37f5533b6bf0c10dd6bfe45224a25f39ea6
Closes-Bug: #1534182
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/08/267608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Container's name will be decided by the driver (returned by method # update_container_name), if no change is required by the driver then # we'll use the one the backup object already has, but if it doesn't # have one backup_default_container will be used. new_container = self.update_container_name(backup, backup.container) if new_container: # If the driver is not really changing the name we don't want to # dirty the field in the object and save it to the DB with the same # value. if new_container != backup.container: backup.container = new_container elif backup.container is None: backup.container = self.backup_default_container
deleted_lines: backup.container = self.update_container_name(backup, backup.container) if backup.container is None: backup.container = self.backup_default_container

commit_message:
[docs] Update to use openstack CLI instead of glance(v1)

glance image-create --is-public option is v1 only. Current Image
Service API version is v2 and should be used.

This patch updates to use openstack CLI.

Related-Bug: #1527219

Change-Id: Ib846a37c90db59489724da7711a7c323d229ad76

commit_message:
Better location for the nova dhcp logs

Use LOGDIR to compute the location of the dhcp logs
instead of hardcoding to /opt/stack/logs/

Change-Id: I97ca2d8c8b7901e0895fe89a57675caf8effea53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/11/267711/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local service="n-dhcp" local logfile="${service}.log.${CURRENT_LOG_TIME}" local real_logfile="${LOGDIR}/${logfile}" if [[ -n ${LOGDIR} ]]; then bash -c "cd '$LOGDIR' && ln -sf '$logfile' ${service}.log" iniset "$NOVA_CONF_DIR/nova-dhcpbridge.conf" DEFAULT log_file "$real_logfile" if [[ -n ${SCREEN_LOGDIR} ]]; then # Drop the backward-compat symlink ln -sf "$real_logfile" ${SCREEN_LOGDIR}/screen-${service}.log fi fi

not in python3.

commit_message:
Python3:Replace iter.next() with next(iter)

function next() of iterator is not available in python3.
ref:http://www.diveintopython3.net/porting-code-to-python-3-with-2to3.html

Targets blueprint: murano-python-3-support

Change-Id: I8cb74520187ba532ad98b86b6ac15737a6cc9bee

commit_message:

Grab duplicated code in add_arp_entry and del_arp_entry.

commit_message:
Remove dead method _get_router_ids

No place is using _get_router_ids, it is dead method now.
And for l3_db.Router related query, it always based on certain
filters, such as on which host, extra attribute is distributed
or HA. While this method cannot fix those requirements.

Method _get_router_ids is created in patch
I35eae975209316aad6b2c97c909dce385729864d , its purpose is to
avoid DB query to fetch full data for routers while only id is
needed. But in patch Ie561b19a2e58a2a563d79b75421e9e24c70f36f9 ,
its caller was removed, but seems we forget to remove this dead
method at that time.

Change-Id: I924e3e652deea2f89c4aaf1fd780e467ea81b843

commit_message:
Flavor id is not a uuid, it's a int.

we use /v2.1/d1c5aa58af6c426492c642eb649017be/flavors/84
to access flavor while 84 represents flavor id, so it's not a uuid.

Change-Id: Id3624030a10af3c1ad5b213f4ce44d80f0d7e78e
Partial-Bug: #1515222

commit_message:
remove user and type field from accepted param

user is added in v2.10 and type added in v2.2
this is v2.1 document so we can remove them and

commit_message:
Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint, port updation API not working

Pass input arguments to neutron port listing API and port updation
APIs, which are used in /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint, in correct
format. list_ports API expects 'fixed-ips' filter in the following
format:
        ['subnet_id=<value>', 'ip_address=<value>']
Similarly, pass input arguments to update_port API in the expected
format.

Change-Id: I28885ca2d8f552f9b25cb4c26ac70cfc1b110e9f
Closes-Bug: #1533001
Closes-Bug: #1532982

commit_message:
Deprecate the S3 driver

As mentioned in this mailing list thread[0], we've started a cleanup
process for the drivers in glance_store. In order to guarantee some
level of stability, we need each driver to have an assigned maintainer
that would be the main contact point for things related to such driver.

The S3 driver doesn't have one. Therefore, as advised in the ML thread,
we're marking it as deprecated and prepare it for removal during the N
development cycle.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/081966.html

Change-Id: I139c36c2d591a55f0f91ea32efa963f80c28e444

commit_message:
Enforce resource rule check before load stored context

We enforce the resource rule check while update stack,
such as for nova flavor resource, we match the admin role
by default, but after change
Id7d6692128964f4ef35762d43ef2738df0d83f4b,
if we enable re-auth, the stored context is used while
check the rule, due we didn't store roles for stored context,
so an error raised even if the request user is admin:
You are not authorized to use OS::Nova::Flavor.

This change enforce the rule checking before load the
stored context. Make sure the rule checking successful.

Change-Id: Ia5383fe10d0d62def28317a4b5388f24fb2f26ea
Partial-Bug: #1529354

commit_message:
v2 - "readOnly" key should be used in schemas

    If it has a value of boolean true, this keyword indicates that the instance property SHOULD NOT be changed,
and attempts by a user agent to modify the value of this property are expected to be rejected by a server.
    The value of this keyword MUST be a boolean.
    The default value is false.

    Further link for reference: http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-hypermedia.html#anchor15

    Glance review-id:   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/267972/
Closes-Bug: #1521581

Change-Id: Ie1282cdc8df0d74ec111d65624ae09b95d468696

subject: Add versioning guideline for API microversions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 02:42:04.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/microversion_specification.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/api-sig/commit/1cc818dccac456947145adb75d09aa0f21fb615e', 'message': 'Add versioning guideline for API microversions

This patch adds versioning guideline for Microversions.

Change-Id: I92f3179cf8281bb3507904deaa902692affdf51b
'}]
commit_message:
Add versioning guideline for API microversions

This patch adds versioning guideline for Microversions.

Change-Id: I92f3179cf8281bb3507904deaa902692affdf51b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/00/269400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Versioning of the API should be a single monotonic counter. It will be of the form X.Y where it follows the following convention: * X will only be changed if a significant backwards incompatible API change is made which affects the API as whole. That is, something that is only very very rarely incremented. * Y when you make any change to the API. Note that this includes semantic changes which may not affect the input or output formats or even originate in the API code layer. We are not distinguishing between backwards compatible and backwards incompatible changes in the versioning system. It will however be made clear in the documentation as to what is a backwards compatible change and what is a backwards incompatible one. There are minimum and maximum versions which are used to describe what the server can understand. The minimum and maximum versions are the oldest and most recent versions supported. The minimum version can be increased when supporting old clients is too great a burden. Increasing the minimum version means break the old clients, this happen very rarely also. Each version includes all the changes since minimum version was introduced. It is not possible to request the feature introduced at microversion X without accepting all the changes before X in the same request. The API changes in X+1 version will hide in the X and early version. That also means specific version keeps all the same always since it's introduced.

commit_message:
Clean flake8 ignore

There is no bad code violating PEP-8 and no need to ignore rules E123 and E125.
So clean the ignore list to do a more strict check.

Change-Id: Icab80c3d642acde01eabb13f402920e48f76edad

commit_message:
Add guideline for microverion bumping

This guideline describes the rules how to bump microverion.

Change-Id: Ib5737fdacb963f282cc0087c387ec62a752536fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/96/187896/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _microversion_bump_guideline: Microversion Bump Guidelines ---------------------------- Basic principle ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The format of microversion is X.Y, the meaning of X and Y defined in the nova-spec: `http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html` Except X is only bumped when a significant backwards incompatible change for the whole API, in the most of cases the API change is required bumped Y. Any API change should be **feature implement or bug fix**, but we should preferentially consider backward compatible way. If we have to do backward incompatible change, this change must provide valuable improvement or significant feature for the API. **Any API change need a nova-spec**, to avoid adding more bad things to the API. Group the change ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ We can group some of changes into same microversion bump. For example: `http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst?id=2015.1.0#n24` But we should make sure that there are not any big bang changes when bumping the microversion, and keep each version small as possible. And groups of similar changes across the API will not be made under a single version bump. This will minimise the impact on users as they can control changes that they want to be exposed to. The change need bump version ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Almost every API change requires microversion bump, so we won't list them all here. We only list the change needn't bump version in next section. The change needn't bump version ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * For changing **500 Internal Server Error** to concrete status code, it does not need microversion bump. Because 500 is an internal error and only be returned when the server has some unrecoverable failure. Therefore changing 500 to concrete code isn't "changing" the API, but rather fixing a bug. For example, a change like this: `https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177018/` * ...This is live document, we will add more case based on what kind of api change request...

commit_message:
Fix image-download to stdout on Python 3.x

Glance image-download to stdout fails on Python3 due to sys.stdout.write
not allowing bytes to be written directly.

A good description of the issue is listed at http://bugs.python.org/issue18512

Closes-Bug: #1528083

Change-Id: I2963914e2e0744410267b5735ff77939413916d4
(cherry picked from commit 3caeb4504e7f96130f904356bf45f93fcd7834c6)

commit_message:
Change flavor-extra-specs return code

201 and 204 is the correct value for create and delete
however, current code didn't handle that and return 200
we should be consistent to code and change doc later
when doc update.

Change-Id: Ie7a6062229f124a091ed6d3cbe43f6b8b5b63834
Partial-Bug: #1515222

commit_message:
[www] Add a Developer Guide link at footer

The developer guide is the direct link which helps the user
to setup account, accepting agreement, submit patches, reviewing
and it definitely useful for first timers without navigating the
wiki page

Change-Id: I3c48961e00aa6fd32017f9c4178c70a11861b724
Closes-Bug: #1421814

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I07cff6c0fe42281a8d88dc6a5105f0ad9a6e6dd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/59/264559/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This file contains a module to return a default set of facts and supported # operating systems for the tests in this module. module OSDefaults def self.get_facts(extra_facts={}) { :os_service_default => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' }.merge(extra_facts) end def self.get_supported_os [ { "operatingsystem" => "CentOS", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "RedHat", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Ubuntu", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "12.04", "14.04" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Debian", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "7", "8" ] } ] end end

subject: Added CORS support to Ceilometer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 07:29:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/c39d592c2d2a88b3a4025018ca3ba4923f86360b', 'message': "Added CORS support to [Ceilometer]

This adds the CORS support middleware to [Ceilometer], allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly. Included
are [Ceilometer]'s custom headers, so that anyone activating this
middleware does not have to explicitly enable them.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: I90d2a53c40e3c353abe3cf37bd7deb3a07aeb043

to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly. Included
are Ceilometer's custom headers, so that anyone activating this
middleware does not have to explicitly enable them.

The paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate responses created
by keystonemiddleware. The test harness was also expanded
to include a full paste.ini functional suite. Use for great justice.

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Ceilometer

This adds the CORS support middleware to Ceilometer, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly. Included
are Ceilometer's custom headers, so that anyone activating this
middleware does not have to explicitly enable them.

The paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate responses created
by keystonemiddleware.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: I90d2a53c40e3c353abe3cf37bd7deb3a07aeb043

neutron-config-ref: IPsec StrongSwan driver implemention

Important notes about StrongSwan v/s OpenSwan.

Change-Id: I564646158b56ac3e5e8957e7f1e82f6b1860a1bf
Closes-Bug: #1433018
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/19/264619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: ``StrongSwan`` and ``OpenSwan`` cannot both be installed and enabled at the same time. The ``vpn_device_driver`` configuration option in the ``vpnaas_agent.ini`` file is an option that lists the vpn device drivers that the Networking service will use. You must choose either one of ``StrongSwan`` or ``OpenSwan`` as part of the list. .. important:: ``StrongSwan`` supports Ubuntu only. To declare either one in the ``vpn_device_driver``: .. code-block:: ini #OpenSwan vpn_device_driver = ['neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.device_drivers.ipsec.OpenSwanDriver'] #StrongSwan vpn_device_driver = ['neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers.strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver']

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I5a8aecadc2dedca3f34f0e240fc5ba977b2cebb3
